repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
This continues and fixes PR https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/1680

There were two issues with it - first it was increfing pointers rather than the values they point to, and second `++atomic<float>` isn't actually valid.

----------------------------------

Personally I think this is a little under-tested. It isn't a PR/feature I have a huge interest but it was one with a simple obvious bug, and one there's some people eager to use. Therefore, I've fixed the bugs but otherwise left it alone.

Therefore, if it needs major changes to make it merge-able then someone else should probably follow it up since I don't think I know enough about `std::atomic` to design sensible tests.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
# mode: run
# tag: cpp, cpp11, werror
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,86 @@
+# distutils: extra_compile_args=-std=c++11
+# mode: run
+# tag: cpp, werror

commit.message: Cython header file for C++ “std::atomic” type

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Cython header file for C++ `std::atomic` type
